intro: Silene otites subsp. velebitica, commonly known as the Velebit catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive floral structures. This subspecies is noted for its adaptability to harsh environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
